Matrix Plots plotting.matrixplots#

Density Plots#

After obtaining the results of an RPSim , it is often helpful to explore the distribution of particles, both along principle axes as well as in phase-space. To do this, we can generate a matrix plot, which shows this distribution and how it evolves at different “snapshots” of a GalaRP simulation. This is especially useful when comparing to snapshots of a hydrodynamical simulation.

import galarp as grp

orbits = sim.run(...)

grp.density_matrix(orbits, outname="matrix_xy.png")

This will plot the x-y plane by default. You can adjust the x-axis and y-axis plot by changing x_ind and y_ind, where the index of what is plotted corresponds to the output of grp.get_orbit_data(orbits), where they are organized as \((x,y,z,v_x,v_y,v_z)\). Thus, to plot the \(x-z\) plane, you would set y_ind=2, and to plot the
